Compressing Images in Powerpoint.

Powerpoint presentations which include lots of images can get very large. If your Powerpoint gets over 2mb in size you will not be able to upload it to Moodle (see below for how to check the size of your presentation).

Compressing your images will dramatically reduce the size of your Powerpoint presentation. Here is a short guide to compressing your images:

  • When you have finished your presentation you will need to use the 'Picture' toolbar. If it is not visible on your screen, select: View > Toolbars > Picture
  • Select the 'compress pictures' button:

Another window will pop-up:

  • If you click on the web/screen button, you will see that the resolution is shown on the right hand side of the window.
  • Click on 'OK'.

Another window will appear:

  • Click on 'Apply'.

Powerpoint may take a few seconds to compress the images in your presentation. When it is finished, the 'Compress Pictures' box will close.

  • Now save your presentation. (File > Save)

Checking the size of your file

To check the size of your file:

  • open 'My Computer' (on your computer desktop)
  • navigate to the file and highlight it by clicking on it.
  • right-click on the file and select 'properties' from the menu that appears.
  • the properties window will appear and you can check the size:
